Unbose

Subject can be a CSS selector (string), array (presumed to be of elements), element, document fragment or an Unbose object.

Summary
UnboseSubject can be a CSS selector (string), array (presumed to be of elements), element, document fragment or an Unbose object.
Events
clickAdds a click event.
onAdd an event listener to the set of elements.
onceAdd an event listener to the set of elements that will be called once and then removed.
Finding and traversing
findFind decendents of the set of objects that match a selector
matchesSelectorCheck if an element matches a selector.
forEachCall a function for all elements in the Unbose set
nameGet the element name of the first element in the set
parentGet the elements parents
ancestorGet the closest ancestor matching filter.
childrenGet the elements children
siblingsGet the siblings of the elements in the set
firstGet the first element in the set
lastGet the last element in the set
prevGet the previous siblings of the elements in the set
nextGet the next siblings of the elements in the set
closestFinds the closest element, ancestor or descendant, that matches the expression.
nthReturns the Unbose object for the nth element in the Unbose set
elemGets an HTMLElement from the Unbose object, or an array of all HTMLElements in the collection.
DOM
appendAppend an element, an unbose object, a template or a zen string
appendElemAppend an element to all elements.
appendTplAppend elements from a template to all elements
appendUnboseAppend an element to all elements.
appendZenAppend elements from a zencoding string
attrSet or get an attribute value.
getAttrGet the value of an attribute
setAttrSet the value of an attribute
emptyRemove all children of the element, or of all elements in the set.
removeRemove the set of elements
textIf argument is given, set text content of elements.
getTextGet the text content of the first element of the set
setTextSet the text content of the set of elements
valSet or get the value of the set of elements
getValget the value of the first element in the set
setValSet the value of the set of elements
dataAssociate arbitrary data with this element.
Style
styleSet or get a style attribute.
getStyleGet the style value of the first element of the set
setStyleSet the style for the elements in the set
widthGets or sets the width of the element
heightGet the height of the element
hasClassCheck if the elements in the set has a specific class
addClassAdd a class to the element, or to all elements in the set
delClassRemoves a class from the element, or to all elements in the set
toggleClassSet class name if it’s not set, unset it otherwise
hideHides the element or set of elements by setting the “display” style property to none.
showShow an element by clearing its display style element.
Static methods
tplFromZen (static)Converts a template array to an element (NOT to an unbose object atm)
eleFromZen (static)Converts a zencode string to an element (NOT to an unbose object atm)
isArray (static)Check if an object is an array
isFunction (static)Check if an object is a function
isElement (static)Check if an object is an element

Events

click

click: function(callback,
capturing)

Adds a click event.  Shorthand for on(“click”, callback);

Parameters

callbackThe class name to delete as a string.
capturingUse capturing.

Returns

The Unbose object

See also

on

on

on: function(name,
callback,
capture)

Add an event listener to the set of elements.

Parameters

nameName of the event
callbackFunction called when event occurs
captureUse capturing

Returns

An Unbose object

once

once: function(name,
callback,
capture)

Add an event listener to the set of elements that will be called once and then removed.

Parameters

nameName of the event
callbackFunction called when event occurs
captureUse capturing

Returns

An Unbose object

Finding and traversing

find

find: function(selector)

Find decendents of the set of objects that match a selector

Parameters

selectorSelector used to find matching elements

Returns

An Unbose object

matchesSelector

matchesSelector: function(selector)

Check if an element matches a selector.  Only checks the first element in a set.

Parameters

selectorSelector to match the element against

Returns

True if the element matches the selector, false otherwise

Caveats

This matcher is a lot less sophisticated than a native one would be.  Currently the following selectors are supported:

  • Tag names
  • Class names
  • IDs
  • Chains of the above
  • Multiple selectors separated by comma

forEach

forEach: function(func,
context)

Call a function for all elements in the Unbose set

Parameters

funcThe function to call
context(optional) context, the value of “this” for the function calls

Returns

An Unbose object

Todo

Should we pass ele or Unbose object to args?

name

name: function()

Get the element name of the first element in the set

Returns

The name of the first element in the set.  Name will always be lower case when returned.

parent

parent: function(filter)

Get the elements parents

Parameters

filterA selector that filters the results

Returns

An Unbose object

See also

children

ancestor

ancestor: function(filter)

Get the closest ancestor matching filter.

Parameters

filterA selector that filters the results

Returns

An Unbose object

See also

parent

Fixme

Returns nearest ancestor or all matching ancestors?

children

children: function(filter)

Get the elements children

Parameters

filterA selector that filters the results

Returns

An Unbose object

See also

parent

siblings

siblings: function(filter)

Get the siblings of the elements in the set

Parameters

filterA selector that filters the results

Returns

An Unbose object

first

first: function()

Get the first element in the set

Returns

An Unbose object

See also

last, nth

last

last: function()

Get the last element in the set

Returns

An Unbose object

See also

first, nth

prev

prev: function(filter)

Get the previous siblings of the elements in the set

Returns

An Unbose object

Parameters

filterA selector that filters the results

See also

next

next

next: function(filter)

Get the next siblings of the elements in the set

Parameters

filterA selector that filters the results

Returns

An Unbose object

See also

prev

closest

closest: function(expr)

Finds the closest element, ancestor or descendant, that matches the expression.

Parameters

exprThe expression for which to search for

Returns

An Unbose object

Todo

Not implemented

nth

nth: function(index)

Returns the Unbose object for the nth element in the Unbose set

Parameters

indexindex in the list

Returns

An Unbose object

Example

Get the second h1 element in the document

Unbose("h1").nth(1);

See also

first, last

elem

elem: function(index)

Gets an HTMLElement from the Unbose object, or an array of all HTMLElements in the collection.

Parameters

indexThe index of the element in the set

Returns

An HTMLElement

Fixme

Should the retval with no args be the array or a copy of it?

DOM

append

append: function(thing)

Append an element, an unbose object, a template or a zen string

Parameters

thingThing to add

Returns

The Unbose object

See also

appendElem, appendTpl, appendUnbose, appendZen

appendElem

appendElem: function(newEle)

Append an element to all elements.  If there are multiple elements in the Unbose object, append clones.

Parameters

newEleElement to add

Returns

The Unbose object

appendTpl

appendTpl: function(tpl)

Append elements from a template to all elements

Parameters

tplTemplate array

Returns

The Unbose object

appendUnbose

appendUnbose: function(ubobj)

Append an element to all elements.  If there are multiple elements in the Unbose object, append clones.

Parameters

eleElement to add

Returns

The Unbose object

appendZen

appendZen: function (zen)

Append elements from a zencoding string

Parameters

tplTemplate array

Returns

The Unbose object

attr

attr: function(name,
val)

Set or get an attribute value.  If value is given, set it.  Of not, just return current value.

Parameters

nameAttribute to get or set
val(optional) Value to set to

Returns

The Unbose object or an attribute

See also

getAttr, setAttr

getAttr

getAttr: function(name)

Get the value of an attribute

Parameters

nameName of the attribute to get

Returns

The value of the attribute.  If attribute does not exist, returns undefined.

Example

Set the src of an image

Unbose("#logo").attr("src", "logo.png");

setAttr

setAttr: function(name,
val)

Set the value of an attribute

Parameters

nameName of the attribute to set
valThe value of the attribute

Returns

The Unbose object

empty

empty: function()

Remove all children of the element, or of all elements in the set.

Returns

The Unbose object

remove

remove: function()

Remove the set of elements

Returns

The Unbose object

Todo

Support expression arg

text

text: function(text)

If argument is given, set text content of elements.  If not, return text content instead.  See setText and getText

Parameters

text(optional) new string

Returns

An Unbose object or a string

See also

getText, setText

getText

getText: function()

Get the text content of the first element of the set

Returns

A string.  If the element has no text content, an empty string.

setText

setText: function(text)

Set the text content of the set of elements

Parameters

textThe text to set

Returns

The Unbose object

val

val: function(val)

Set or get the value of the set of elements

Parameters

text(optional) The text to set

Returns

The value of the Unbose object

See also

getVal, setVal

getVal

getVal: function()

get the value of the first element in the set

Returns

The value

See also

val, setVal

setVal

setVal: function(val)

Set the value of the set of elements

Parameters

textThe value to set

Returns

The value of the Unbose object

See also

val, setVal

data

data: function(name,
val)

Associate arbitrary data with this element.  The value will be converted to a string.

Parameters

nameThe name to get or to set a value forEach
valThe value to setAttribute

Returns

If a value is set, it returns an Unbose object, otherwise, it returns the value.

Style

style

style: function(attr,
value)

Set or get a style attribute.

Parameters

attrName of style attribute
value(optional) new value of style attribute

Returns

An Unbose object or a string

See also

setStyle, getStyle

getStyle

getStyle: function(prop)

Get the style value of the first element of the set

Parameters

propThe name of the style attribute

Fixme

Should it get from first or all?  If all, how?  What if not in dom?  Fall back to .style?  Should there be any kind of normalization? colors are hex in opera and rgb in chrome/ff

setStyle

setStyle: function(prop,
value)

Set the style for the elements in the set

Parameters

propThe property to set
valueThe property’s value

Returns

An Unbose object

width

width: function(value)

Gets or sets the width of the element

Parameters

valueSets the width of the element (optional)

Returns

The width of the element, without padding and borders, in pixels

height

height: function(value)

Get the height of the element

Parameters

valueSets the height of the element (optional)

Returns

The height of the element, without padding and borders, in pixels

hasClass

hasClass: function(cls)

Check if the elements in the set has a specific class

Parameters

clsThe class name to check for

Returns

True if all the elements in the set has the class, false othwerwise

See also

delClass, hasClass, toggleClass

addClass

addClass: function(cls)

Add a class to the element, or to all elements in the set

Parameters

clsThe class name to add as a string.

Returns

The Unbose object

See also

delClass, hasClass, toggleClass

delClass

delClass: function(cls)

Removes a class from the element, or to all elements in the set

Parameters

clsThe class name to delete as a string.

Returns

The Unbose object

See also

addClass, hasClass, toggleClass

toggleClass

toggleClass: function(cls)

Set class name if it’s not set, unset it otherwise

Parameters

clsThe class name to toggle.

Returns

The Unbose object

See also

addClass, hasClass, delClass

hide

hide: function()

Hides the element or set of elements by setting the “display” style property to none.

Returns

The Unbose object

show

show: function()

Show an element by clearing its display style element.

Returns

The Unbose object

Todo

Not implemented

Static methods

tplFromZen (static)

Unbose.tplFromZen = function(zen)

Converts a template array to an element (NOT to an unbose object atm)

eleFromZen (static)

Unbose.eleFromZen = function(zen)

Converts a zencode string to an element (NOT to an unbose object atm)

isArray (static)

Unbose.isArray = function(obj)

Check if an object is an array

Parameters

objthe object to check

Returns

boolean, true if object is an array.  Otherwise false.

Note

Copied from

http://perfectionkills.com- /instanceof-considered-harmful-or-how-to-write-a-robust-isarray- /

isFunction (static)

Unbose.isFunction = function(obj)

Check if an object is a function

Parameters

objthe object to check

Returns

boolean, true if object is a function.  Otherwise false.

isElement (static)

Unbose.isElement = function (obj)

Check if an object is an element

Parameters

objthe object to check

Returns

boolean, true if object is an element.  Otherwise false.
